item.title: @patrickmineault I read this paper when it came out. It’s well done. I’ve had some great undergrads doing smth similar since 2021- you saw the setup when you were in Santa Barbara. We have a computer in the loop, so we can do backprop either in the software model, or in the hybrid physical model.

item.title: Born #Today in 1888, Inge Lehmann was the first true female geophysicist in the world. She discovered that the Earth has a solid inner core inside a molten outer core, identifying the Lehmann Discontinuity in the seismic structure of the Earth [read more: https://t.co/IaoSrwjxq0] https://t.co/oXhr9k7wgb

item.title:
The Newton's cannon, or why objects in orbit are just what you shot hard enough they keep missing the Earth. The speed of the ball to accomplish this feat is 7.9 km/s or 28,440 km/h and 84.4 minutes before an unwary gunner is hit on the back of his head
https://t.co/ZAaDgN1cT3 https://t.co/uklwzKfHkj

item.title:
The Cliffs of Moher are located at the southwestern edge of the Burren region in County Clare, Ireland: they run for about 14 km. At their southern end, they rise 120 mabove the Atlantic Ocean
[photo by Max Malloy, IG: https://t.co/8pE8OCue1C, site: https://t.co/8BEDGw9TKJ] https://t.co/mXfoWvtaKY
